review: when I was herethey had good food I will always come back when I have the money againm
My kids love this place but my service was just too friendly and seem fake. My food was good.

I can tell what is wrong with this Red Robin. The cooks are banking the patties and sometimes you get a cold patty. Especially before closing. Sometime the fries are old too, but you can ask for more and have a 50/50 chance of getting some fresh.

I hear good things about Red Robin, and being that I had a birthday engagement at the Block, it felt like the perfect time to try it out.   They are known for their burgers, and now I see why!   I ordered the Bleu Bacon Burger and my boyfriend ordered the Steak sandwich with Au Jus sauce.  Both of them were fabulous, burt the dipping sauces that come with the fries are even better!   From honey mustard to buffalo to ranch, I believe everything is homemade.   So delicious.   I have such a weakness for fries, and they offer bottomless steak fries.   Perfect!   Even though I'm not a fan of chain restaurants, this burger joint really isn't bad for the price or the environment.

This Red Robin has some of the best chicken burgers and onion rings around. The service is good, and being able to pick up food to go here is wonderful! We always seem to be a busy family on the run! The Village of Orange is pretty busy, especially on weekends, but finding a restaurant where picking up food is quick and easy is quite the find. With a "10 minute parking" for picking up food (or "30 minute parking" when the 10 minute parking spots are full), we really like this added convenience. Whether we eat here or take food to go, the service is also really good here! While my husband usually gets a salad, I usually order the Whiskey River Chicken Burger. It's messy and delicious. With the just the right amount of barbecue sauce, cheese, lettuce, tomato, and onions on this burger, I am perfectly content after my meal here. Add some of the best onion rings ever, and I'm in heaven! My husband's salads are always hearty and delicious as well. We really like the convenience, service, and most of all, food at this Red Robin location. I might be a tad biased, but I think their chicken burger and onion rings are just that delicious!!!

Came here on a Sunday night, and it was prettty packed. Service was alright..  My food came out longer than I expected, but that's probably because there were so many big groups before me.  I ordered the whiskey river BBQ burger, which was about $10 and comes with a side of fries. The hamburger itself was not bad..it wasn't messy and the flavors were good. It was also cooked all the way through like I asked. The fries aren't good plain in my opinion. I suggest you sprinkle the fries seasoning on them. I bought leftovers home and the fries are MUCH better when they're soggy and have soaked all the seasoning ;) Overall, food is good and the hamburgers are pretty big.

I come here every once in a while and it keeps getting better every time. Our server Brandi Was amazing brought me mad ranch fries and beer I love her, she is the best always stays on top of everything ,this chick deserves a raise or something.

First off, I'm only giving this Red Robin 5 stars because of their server Brandi. My boyfriend and I recently started coming here more often because of her. We took a little trip into there last night, our food always comes super fast and we are never left with an empty fry basket. She remembers everything we like and is on top of the ball. Most servers are pretty snobby and not caring, but high five Red Robin you got yourself a keeper in there! Will be back very soon ;)

First Red Robin that I actually had good service, a correct order and a clean fork. What is it about every Red Robin that I have been to that my fork is dirty. Seriously, do they see me coming or what?!?  We asked our server what sauces they had for there appetizers and after rattling off all that they offer, she actually came back with all of them just so we could try them. Scored big points from me because I like things saucy ;-) The burgers are huge and almost fall apart but with the good buns they use, I can still manhandle them into my mouth with only minimal drippage on my hands. Love the continuous basket of fries, they come out hot and they bring them to you before I shamefully have to ask for more. Who doesn't have room for more french fries in their lives? Definitely be back to this one since it is right down the street. Stay away during Christmas because the parking lot is CHAOS!!
Great food, great service and lots of friendly employees!!!  That's what will make me come back!!!!  Just don't come here for Wifi service. They don't offer it, even though Yelp says they do!

I realy enjoy red robin. I come in all the time because I enjoy their burgers and wraps, plus you can't go wrong with the bottomless steak fries, especially lathered in there ranch and proposers honey mustard, best honey mustard I've ever tried.

We like to go there for the delicious burgers! Love how I can order any burger and substitute the beef patty for a turkey or veggie patty. Service is beyond friendly, they come around your table often to make sure everything is going ok and if you need anything. Surprisingly even when they have lots of customers they provide exceptional customer service. Makes customers feel valued!

I love the burgers at Red Robin and every Red Robin has had the same quality of food. This is a good sign of chain restaurant that cares about the food that comes out their kitchens. Any burger on the menu will satisfy the carnivore inside you.
I love Red Robin.  Period.

It's Red Robin, what the hell can I really tell you that you don't know already? I go for the bottomless steak fries coupled with gobs of ranch, drenched in RR seasoning, with a huge dollop of ketchup in the middle of the cup. Sounds nasty but the concoction is truly delicious. I order the Whiskey River burger with egg (split in half), and sit outside so I can smell Tuwanda and Juanita smoking their Kool and Kent cigarettes (respectively) at the entrance of the Orange "Mall," or Village or whatever the hell it is while I listen to the cheesy mall music over the loudspeaker, coupled with the squeaky entrance doors that need to be oiled, which add a saxophone-like break to the shitty music. If it's summertime, you can usually sit and wonder what the hell all the parentless children are doing in their Fruit of the Looms, running through the mall fountain, which is a huge plus if you're a sick pervert.  But back to the fries. Decent meal, decent service from Tanita outside -- she brought the fries before the entrees were done (as requested) -- thanks! She also didn't forget us even though we were the only ones out there. Will return as cravings permit.

Ordered to-go there last night and it was horrible.  All the meals we ordered that had fries with them came with like 10 fries...if we had eaten in the restaurant it is bottomless fries so why not pack them in there for to-go orders?  One of our orders was a BBQ chicken salad (without the chicken for a vegetarian) but it had very little BBQ sauce on it.

Slowwwwwwwwwwwwwwww. we seen our food waiting on the p/u line for 10 to 15 min half the food was cold the server was nowhere to be found it was a bad experiance,we usally love red robin not this time tho..

i have to say, this is one of the best red robin's I've been too Great service, good food, and fair prices.  I hate how they don't have kettle corn chips anymore :(. and that they charge for chipotle mayo! (i can get 10 sides of ranch, but not a chipotle mayo?!)

In response to me checking in at Red Robin, there was a chorus of people's yum's shooting back at me. Damn those silly jingles! Why do I go here? Consistently good food, bottomless strawberry (aka freckled) lemon aid, and the best damn fish & chips at the Orange Mall. Service was excellent, I got to watch the end of the football game while dining and picked up a rewards card, too. Dinged one star for the magical and unexpected disappearing hostess trick and my drink splashing all over the table when it was served. Oops.
Had the awsome octoberfest burger!!! Still my favorite burger!!! Great service excellent food and happy hour!!!

I have been dining at this location for about 15 years, and it has always been my reliable go-to spot that has something for everyone's taste.  I'm particularly fond of their burgers, especially the Whiskey River Barbeque Burger (both chicken and beef versions).  Then there's the Bottomless Fries, with plenty of ranch dressing for dipping.   And what's better than a FREE Burger on your birthday, through their Red Robin Rewards Card program (sign-up required). While waiting for the meal to arrive, I like to check-out the eclectic collection of photos, movie posters, and memorabilia that decorates almost every square inch of wall space.   The last few times I've been to this location, the already good service has improved noticeably.  Everyone from the managers to the servers has provided  exceptionally prompt and courteous service.  From the cheerful greeting, to offering iced tea in a to-go cup upon leaving, to the warm farewell, I felt valued throughout my dining experience.

Rachel our server was wonderful!! Such a great personality! Drinks filled the entire time! She made sure we had everything!  Food great as always & she made it even better! Kids loved her! That was a plus! Will be back like usual! ;)

Went here for happy hour on a Thursday. Everything was decent. My only complaint was that the guacamole that came with the salsa, guac, and chips, was old. It wasnt bright green, so it was obviously sitting out for awhile.  Otherwise, the bar staff was friendly and very efficient. Didnt have to wait long on our food at all. The prices for their happy hours items were what you would expect. Decent selection of beers, smaller selection of wines. But when you need a drink, just about anything will do. =)

I love Red Robin.  It's consistent and yummy!  They have the best turkey burgers, which is what I get 90% of the time.  It's a healthy option when ordered without the mayo and bun.   Obviously, the fries are amazing and endless, which goes well with a turkey burger.  My hubby gets their Red Robin Royal, which is amazing.  We prefer these burgers over Islands any day. My little kids really love the kids meals and I especially like how their menus have pictures so my kids can practice ordering by circling what they want.  They too provide healthy side options for the kids.  This place is perfect for kids. Service is always efficient and quick.

Dinner time for the Lynns... That's 6 kids and 2 adults. We always get the same table and we love the service here. They always treat my kids as if they've known them for years. In my book that's a place where I can spend any amount of money to see my family happy. The food is always good and the burgers are great.  The salted caramel is bomb!! It really balances out after eating a Royal Red Robin or a prime rib dip. Can't get enough of this place.

Great atmosphere, great service, great food.   You can never go wrong with a bottomless basket of huge yummy fries with a side of ranch, maui wings appetizer, cheese sticks appetizer, and the banzai burger is made to perfection every time. They are also super fast, my appetite is taken care of asap.

Nathan was our server, not only did he bring us our food quick fast and hurried. He did so while fighting off an army of yodeling zombies riding three armed rainbow colored polar bears. Then when that was done he made the balloon animals, flew a kite, did a ventriloquist act, sang the star spangled banner, on a unicycle while juggling rabbits blindfolded at the same time. This place is awesome.

Last night my sister and i had dinner at Red Robin of Orange. And although we didn't have a yelp account we decided to make one. Our waitress Jossie, was most helpful and made our dinning experience so much more. she was professional and personal, it wasnt like she was doing a task but something more, she was very enjoyable. which in return we had a great time. Her service was phenomenal. And the dinner was classic and delicious. Bottomless french fries and burgers, how could you go wrong? We'll definitely be back, to have delicious meal and too see some friendly familiar faces. Thank you Red Robin Yum
Love their fries and shakes!!  Staff is very friendly and welcoming.

Very disappointed! Server Percy was ridiculously over perky to the point is was fake. I have been going there for too many years to count. My burger was barely brown on the out side and under cooked for Medium rare. Cook forgot the guacamole on the burger. It seemed that the Manager was the one the put the food on the table and 3 minutes later Percy put the check on the table and we didn't see him again.

red robin is a past time fav... kinda like applebee's or TGIFridays... so you really can't knock anything but the service. the service here is awesome! every time we're here, we always end up with the same waiter... and i'm a lil embarrassed to admit that i can't remember his name by now.  but he is fun and entertaining and just adds to the experience!  if you've never been to red robin... a must try is their burgers.  honestly, i think i order the same burger every time... guacamole bacon burger... unless i'm feeling too guilty to indulge, then i order a cobb salad. there's a burger to satisfy everyone's pallet. and my favorite part (more so than the burgers)... the fully stocked bar with a fruity haven of fun signature cocktails.

I love Red Robin's food! I have been to many different locations and each one that I have been to, I have had excellent service. Today, I ordered the Whiskey BBQ burger with the garlic fries. It was amazing! yum yum The server was extremely nice and very friendly. Can't wait to visit again soon

Went today with the man, have to say I was not happy with their "re-vamp" .. where's the basket of fries?! I got this ring mold of fries and when I asked for a refill. .the "basket" literally had 10 fries in it..all the hard small crunchy pieces! Wtf?! BRING BACK THE CHEAPY LOOKING BASKET WITH THE MOUND OF FRIES!  I had the bleu ribbon burger.. which was good but no $10.49 good! My hubby was Pissed to know that when you order the Red's Big Tavern burger.. the " bigger" burger is actually a normal sized single patty.. SINGLE! So that's why they hid the pic of the burger behind the regular Tavern burger. Btw, the regular Tavern burger may have two patties, but they are smaller than the normal size patties!  Shouldn't you say that in the description on the menu? All in all.. food was good, service was good. .but the lack of refill fries and price just aren't worth it to come back, especially for people on a budget. Oh, and I don't like the rush of putting my check in front of me so I can pay and the waiter can move on to priority tables... maybe I wanted another round of 10 fries!

This is probably my favorite Red Robin location in the area. I really like the ambiance of the place, nice and open with a lot of booths. It has pictures all over the place which serve as an amusing distraction while you're waiting for your food. Incidentally the food doesn't really seem to take that long to make. I can't recall ever having to wait around for too long while the food was being cooked. I've never had a bad tasting experience while here. They also seem to have a pretty good selection of beer compared to other places I've visited. The bar seems pretty open and friendly, not hidden away in a corner or anything and like I said the burgers are really good!

I came here with my sister for dinner. She got this burger with bacon and cheese and whatever else was on it. She seemed to enjoy her burger, but couldn't finish it. We wanted to try the buzzard sauce which had a horrible texture, but a slightly yummy kick. I am a vegetarian so I ordered the "burnin love burger" with a veggie patty It was so gross!! The patty was not the problem, it could have been meat and still taste like shit. There were flimsy, soggy, doughy jalapeño chips on it that was gross. They had tomatoes AND salsa on the burger which tasted so bad. I was so confused as to what was going on in my mouth. It was beyond disgusting. The whole burger was lukewarm on the verge of cold and sloppy. There was also a whole jalapeño stabbed through with a wooden spike on my burger. I guess they tried to get fancy...am I supposed to eat the fucking jalapeño? Why would someone just eat a whole burnt jalapeño? I wanted to exchange the burger, but I didn't want my food spat it. I tried to finish the mess because wasting food is a sin in my culture, but I only made it halfway before I felt too sick to continue. Island's costs about the same, but has larger burgers that taste about 100 times better. Don't waste your time and money at this place when you can get better food, service, and portions somewhere else.

I love this place, I always have. There's so many great things on the menu! Service is usually amazing. I love the atmosphere. Parking sucks though because it's at a mall. Sometimes it can be really packed, so make a reservation or call ahead

OH WOW. Let me just say how disappointed I was last night. NONE of the servers I  know were there..the manager was a new one, who couldn't have been bothered with anything. The old manager I know is super friendly and awesome..last night was horrendous.  We went there for my birthday, as it's an annual tradition. I have never had such poor service in my life at this location..I probably jinxed it with my last review. The new servers are SO RUDE. Anyway, the one we had last night, I will not mention her name, was horrible. She acted as though everything we needed from her was an additional chore. Well you know what, maybe when we ask for it the first time - you could bring it? With a side of less attitude? My burger was made wrong so I sent it back. Then the manager brought it out and I told him the pickles were missing so please can I have them on the side with tartar? He said "I'll just go tell your server." NEVER have I had a manager say that to me..whenever there is something wrong, the manager happily brings things out. When we asked the manager for something else last night..again, he acted as though it was a chore for him. WTH? Disappointing.  The server brings out the check. My sister had given her a cake when we got there..so she forgot that, which was no big. So she brings out the cakes..just the cake. What are we going to cut and eat it with? Our hands??? So I'm like "umm can we have a knife, forks, and some plates?" She sighs and go gets them.  And my birthday song? So we told them that too. I can't believe how disappointing the service was yesterday. I come to this  location at least once a week..I come here every year on my birthday and wow..rude service. Lack of common sense.

April did a great job.  She greeted us brightly,did her job well and was very attentive.  She did indicate she had a rough night, but you wouldn't have noticed. As we showed up a group of 24 showed up, fortunately we did not have the same waitress.  I felt sorry for her, at least 7 of the group was kids under 9 and they were swarming like angry hornets. I had the prime chophouse with was a great idea but didn't have as much horseradish as I'd have liked.   I guess I need to experiment more with their dipping sauces for the fries as the Thai sauce just didn't work for me. Still I like my burger medium rare and the closest they'll cook it is medium.  This in my opinion kills off too much of the meats flavor.

Had a great burger as always! The service was good tonight, I wouldn't say great!! At first they brought out some frys but after a short time they brought a big basket. This place always seems clean. The hostess was very friendly and got are table ready fast.
Red Robin is so yummy!!!!  Pros:  Yummy Food  Wonderful Staff  Steak Fires!!!  Cons:  It can be crowded  Bathrooms are nice but have a weird smell.  Overall, I would rate this restaurant a 4/5 stars.

I tried the smoke and pepper burger on ciabatta and it was delicious. It was a unique new flavor. Service was good and quick and everyone, including the hostess, was very friendly. I will definitely go back.
Best Dam Burger ever. Well maybe not the best ever, but pretty darn close. Too bad i cant eat this way all the time. Good service - fair prices. Skimpy servings of fries but you can ask for more.

We have been eaten here for years. It usually is good and consistent. Last week was a disappointment.  Got sat at  crappy table. Food took forever. My sons burger was incorrect (he asked for no cheese). It took SO long for them to re-make his burger that we had all finished our food. Poor guy sat there eating while we all stared at him. They said they would remove the burger from our bill but they never did. My husband was too embarrassed for me to say anything so I paid the bill and we left.  Never had this happen at Red Robin before :(
I was craving a teriyaki burger so came here for the banzai burger. Definitely hit the spot. Good was great and service was great. Ashlie was a great waitress! Will be back again.

When you get to this place, bar seating may be faster but the service is beyond slow. Should just wait for regular seats. Something was previously spilled on the floor and told the waitress is very slippery and she never came back to wipe it up. I guess they don't care if I get up and fall.  It's a lawsuit waiting to happen.  Burgers are just OK. Honestly nothing special. The strawberry lemonade and the clam chowder are very tasty. I really doubt I'll ever come back to this location. Just cuz of the service.

This location looks really cool inside and is a great place to watch a game or take a date too. Bottomless fries is awesome! Sweet potatoe fries, deepfried chips, garlic parmesan fries, and onion rings too, yum! They have a bunch of dipping sauces too. Staff is super chill and they have happy hour specials and cool mixed drinks.
Awesome service our waitress was great so friendly and patient even when we were fussing with our girls! And the option for endless regular, sweet potato fries or broccoli is wonderful!
Not only the bottomless fries now they have free refills on the root beer float. Yum. They also have a great burger.

I just finished lunch at the Red Robin in Orange and was extremely disappointed with the Chicken Ensenada Platter that was $9.99.  I got a very small chicken breast (probably less than 3 oz), 2 tablespoons of salsa and a cup of terrible, soupy fruit salad.  I was with friends celebrating a birthday so I did not raise a fuss at the restaurant.  I called the manager, Tai, when I returned home who apologized and said the chicken breast should be 5 oz and he apologized for the poor quality.  I told him the chicken sandwich at Carl's Jr is much better for less than $5.
Service is kind of slow but love their banzai burger!

I like coming here, food is good and it has a nice environment. Today I had a French onion soup which was pretty decent for like $5.50 they always play sports so that's cool. I e had better burgers than this plays but there ok. The artichoke and spinach dip is great!

Went in tonight. Were greeted by the host and walked to a table by the bar, my mom didn't like it so we asked if there was anything else. The host was super gracious and asked us if we would like a table or booth and took us to a booth talking to us the whole way. We got to our table and our servers (one was training) greeted us promptly. Drinks were almost immediate and we ordered an appetizer (spinach artichoke dip) that was out in just minutes as well. So fast! We ordered our main course, Banzai burger and the Whiskey River BBQ Chicken Salad. We both really enjoyed what we ordered. Again, our food was out fast and our cups were never even close to being empty. Our server was in training and he did an amazing job with the help of the girl training him. We were kind of complicated because It was my moms birthday and she was there for her free burger and I had military discount but they were super nice and it wasn't even an issue. The manager came and checked on us too. Over all, what a great experience. Join their e-club! You get so many rewards and they make it easy! Will be back!

My family and I see Red Robin as one of the only restaurants that we can all agree on. This location is very close to us and we have not have Amazing service, just average here. We, like everyone else, look for the "whole experience" where there is not only food but great service as well. Having great service is memorable.  We choose this location because of how close it is... but the best service is the Garden Grove location near Disneyland. I gave this Red Robins 3 stars more for its food, not the service.

Came in for lunch yesterday with the wife. The staff were all friendly. I forgot our server's name but I thunk it was Landsey or something like that. The service was slower than I was hoping for but that wasn't a big deal and that should be expected when sitting by the bar. I ordered the black and bleu and it was very delicious. I don't usually order burgers but I made an exception (being that it was a burger joint) and I'm glad I did. I don't even know how to describe it except it was something I'VE NEVER tasted before. I think I'll go back next week just for that. Overall I give them 4 stars. :-)

We had a great experience we were in and out for lunch. I had the wiskey bbq chicken sandwish is was delicious. Fast and friendly  service,  Amy was amazing on top of every need, refills, fries, napkins. we never had to ask for anything next time I'll be asking for her. This location surely has a new regular

Red Robin is one of those places that has become a kid restaurant.  It has really gone to far, last time two groups had infants IN THE BAR!  One couple was sitting in the booth to which the "You must be 21 to enter the bar" sign was attached.  Oh well, at least you know what you are getting into when you go. I go for the Whiskey River Chicken Sandwich.  I want to order other stuff but I can't.  It is perfect. The new beer-based cocktails are good as well.

I am sure you are all familiar with Red Robins food. Its not that bad but its nothing that is spectacular My last experience in here was not a good one. I came in on Labor Day at about 6ish. It was pretty busy and my group of 4 decided we would just sit at table in the bar area.  Now keep in mind the bar area has booths and tables so we grabbed an open table cause we were starving. My wife had our 2 month old in a ring sling sleeping up against her. We were told that we had to move because the bar is 21 and over. REALLY??? We were not sitting at the actual bar top. If that was the case I understand but come on. What is my 2 month old gonna sneak in a mojito or a shot of whiskey? This is not freaking Pauls or Marty's, Red Robin you need to lighten up.  We had to move which resulted in us having to wait for a table for another 15 minutes. Just not a great experience. I really don't understand if I am at a table in a so called "bar area" what does it matter. As a parent I am responsible for my child let me be the parent Red Robin, not you.

My family and I had dinner on 9/7/2014, around 7:30 pm. It wasn't busy at all and we were seated in Drew's section. After waiting approximately 10 minutes, Drew came over to take out order. He seemed nice enough. Our food was brought out quickly. Once we started eating, Drew barely checked on us. So much for getting bottomless fries and refills on my Freckled Lemonade. Not once did he ask us if we wanted more fries. I had to ask him for a refill on the lemonade. When I said "excuse me" to get his attention, because we needed more napkins, he turned around and replied, "Yo". Huh?! He lacked customer service and follow up. We overheard the table behind us debating on whether or not to leave him a tip, as they had to ask him several times for drink refills and more fries. He dropped the bill off and never bothered to ask if we wanted anything else. Any good server will always ask if the customers would be interested in dessert, etc. Very disappointed with his lack of interest. He was just going through the motions and clearly had no desire to provide proper customer service. We deliberately left him a penny tip to make a point. Don't get a job in the service industry if you don't want to accommodate people.

Great service and good priced burgers. My all time favorite is the royal red robin burger.  There's just something about the egg that I love.  Also the endless steak fries are the best. When I say good service.....I mean when I walk in the door I get greeted.  And then the servers are prompt.... In this particular occasion the egg was undercooked and the yolk leaked over the bottom of the bun and caused it to be soggy.  I told the server and they replaced my burger right away.  Some businesses you just dont get that kind of service. Everyone is happy to help. Highly recommend for a $10 burger.
What I can say about Red Robin is food was terrible and the service was worse, I won't recommend this restaurant nor will I return this particular one again.

I had fond memories of Red Robin back in my high school days when my friends worked there. Meal was big, freckled strawberry was delicious and burger was mouth watering.  My taste buds have either refined or that this Red Robin doesnt believe in quality control. I'm inclined to agree with the latter.  I ordered the bruschetta chicken burger with onion rings while my cousin asked for the smoke and pepper burger with fries. My buns for the burger were abysmal, it seemed like they were stale and lifeless while the chicken tasted very bland. I left over 1/3 of my plate unconsumed. As for my cousin, I have to give props to the menu designer because his burger didn't even resemble the delicious photoshopped image.  I mean, at least the lemonade tasted the same....

Great burgers! The slogan is spot on. This is one of my favorite sit down nice family restaurants to enjoy a delicious juicy burger with all the gourmet ingredients. You can't go wrong. Enroll for the Red royalty rewards club to enjoy a burger on your birthday month. Oh and now they offer adult beer shakes. Say what?!! Irish beer shake will be on our next trip.

Took my mom for her birthday. Crappy service. We sat outside. It was like our waiter forgot about us. The food was very tasty, but when we needed another refill or anything else we couldn't. The waiter was m.I.a. Disappointing. If I'm going to pay for a service I at least expect one refill, and napkins! Oh, and silverware.

Food was great, service was terrible. Went on 10/18/14 for a late lunch. Waiter came right away and took our drink orders. Was super friendly and realized we had a very active 18 month old with us. He seemed to understand we didn't have time wait around. After we placed our order we never saw him again. Had to hunt down other servers for napkins, silverware, sides of sauces we had originally requested at the time we ordered, and refills on our drinks. Very disappointed and was very frazzled by the time we left. Won't be going back to this location anytime soon!

Amqzi g hamburgersand goid drinks. Servers sre knowledgeable and friendly.  Avoid eating in the bar, food service is slow an unpredictable.  Food is often cold and getting refills means tracking down your server!
The burgers and fries were spectacular, but our host Alex deserves a 5 star rating. Alex was sociable and friendly, without being pushy or sounding forced. Sweet potato fries were killer.

Yesterday my husband and I went for dinner to this location it was semi busy but very understaffed.  The hostess asked us if we wanted to sit on the bar or wait we waited but she still took us to the bar. She sat us in a table by the patio exit the ledges around the wall were full of dust and the wall was really dirty this makes me think if this is the front of the house I wonder what the back of the house looks like.  There was one bartender for the whole bar and the patio plus to make all the drinks that were coming out she did her best but it was just too much for one person, the manager tried to go in there but had no clue how to make the drinks so he just left, at a point the bartender ( tanita ) told a guest that she was really busy she had all those tables, drinks to make and the hostess kept on sitting her. We order a BBQ chicken sandwich with garlic fries and the chicken sandwich. They gave us fries with just parsley on top when the menu says tossed in garlic.  We got a second one that was better.  My bun was hard and cold I got a raw frie I told her and not even like that the manager dared to stop by. We waited a while for our first drink we had to go to the hoststand because we had food and no silverware we had to ask for refills and it took a while to get them. The busser who was cleaning the bar left the black tray full of dishes in the floor where a guest almost trip over, the whole experience was just not what you hope  for. Maybe you need to retrain your managers on how to manage the floor, deal with guest, and be able to work in different stations like the bar. Very disappointed definitely will think twice before coming in and it's a shame because your food is usually good.

I am a frequent diner at this and the Costa Mesa RR.  Although it's been a couple of months and I cannot believe how this location has gone down hill. My visit was Saturday, October 25th right about noon.  The place was not busy.  I stood at the hostess booth for 3 minutes before she showed up.  Never apologized for the wait, didn't say hello..she said "how many"?  I said 2 for a booth..she said it's going to be a wait.  Looking around and seeing at least 15 booths available I figured they must be short-handed and said I would wait.  5 minutes later she said she had a booth ready and tried seating us in the bar area.  I told her I don't want to sit in the bar area, I prefer the restaurant.  She said "this is part of the restaurant"...so then I had to point to the area of the restaurant I was referring to (the part without a bar).  She said "well it's going to be a wait"...I said fine.  She then turned to the woman waiting for a booth and laughed as she said "do you have a problem sitting in the bar area, if not I can take you now".  Such a rude hostess.  The first impression is this girl, who clearly just rolled out of bed and came to work by her appearance.  In face, both hostesses were a sloppy mess.   Finally we get seated.  The service was slow.  When our food arrived, my friends burger was half the size of mine so he asked the lady who brought it over (not our server) and she said "that is the tavern burger and they are smaller.  He said "why don't you tell people that because the picture doesn't show that and neither does the price.  Her response "well we expect that people will read the menu"...REALLY????  Then my friend complains to our server and he just kinda laughed and said yeah that's the way that burger is and you can get unlimited fries in case this doesn't fill you up.  He never came back to the table after that.  For our refills, to see if my friend did want extra fries...never saw him again until he dropped off the bill. I have never had such poor service here.  I did see a manager that I haven't seen before and I always consider poor service a reflection of the manager.  Somebody needs to wake these people up.  I will not return to that location.

Good location. Large space, clean, and friendly staff. Quick service too. Family friendly restaurant.  Tried their regular hamburger and mushroom burger before. Good taste. Fresh and has flavor. Average sized. Didn't like their fries because it's the fat type of fries. Too thick. You eat just a few and you are full.   Also had their ice cream sundae dessert. Good dessert because it's a small size. It's just enough unlike some other desserts which are just way much and too filling.  I think their bottomless fries and drinks are a good deal for big eaters.

I came in on Veterans day and I got the whole 9 yards. I got excellent service and a bomb double tavern cheeseburger with fries. It's a franchise so it's kind of the typical Red Robin that you step into anywhere else but the service I got really made this Red Robin stand out more than others I've been to. The food was great, the service was great and at the end of my meal I received a card signed by some of the staff at Red Robin thanking me for my service that I actually still have in my car. It means a lot when a restaurant not only appreciates a regular customer but when they appreciate a vet that's a different kinda of customer service. Thank you Red Robin and thank you for showing the troops some love.

Great time... Great food once again. Had the tortilla soup and whiskey bbq salad. Waitress Amy and assistant manager were extremely helpful. I usually always sit in Amy's station because she is personable and seems more understanding to my family's needs. She always keeps me coming back. Thank you for once again a great Red Robin experience. Its seems to be my favorite location and I've been to many.

My brother was coming home from the forces and I did the surprise dinner for my family, here it was amazing every thing came out perfect just like I wanted things to be.  Staff was amazing as well grate survives friendly and coped with my crazy idea  I was every pleased.

Bad service meat not cooked thru. Fries were over done, dry and cold. Most are good this time it was a waste of money when seated there was crumbs left on the booth seat from the last person. Yuck!  Need better management.

Very disappointed  I used to love this place. But recently the service has been downhill and horrible. I have ordered out and had to wait much longer then promised and when I get my food it is half cold! This has happened on multiple occasions. I will never be back Red Robin has lost a customer and I will be sure to pass this along to my close family and friends.

Yaay. Perfect place to satisfy a burger craving! All of the Red Robin's chains that I've been to have consistently had great service and food and this one was no exception. My go to fav is the bonzai burger with a gardenburger, and it is soo good! The delicious sweet pineapple with the savory sauce is heaven. Haha. And of course you can never go wrong with bottomless fries! :D

We have been going to this particular location for about a year now.  The food has definitely improved in quality since several years ago.  The gourmet burgers are solid.  The customer service has vastly improved as well.  We are total fans!

This place was amazing! The service was great, the food was great, everything was great! I have rarely been to a place where the waitresses are very friendly or helpful. Not sure if all of the ones who work her are but the waitress we got was very helpful and friendly. I think her name was daisy. I will definitely be returning soon.

went here for my birthday because i'm signed up for their loyalty club- free burger in your birth month. i always get the royal burger and get onion rings. the burger was great and the onion rings were fresh. good quality and pretty fast.
Great service great people great food! My daughter loves it here. We come here for our dinner dates. I tell her to pick a place n always picks Red Robin!

I was very disappointed the last visit I had .. My waitress was almost never around..she served us over the divider of the walk way from the kitchen instead of at our table when I asked for more water she told me give me your cup then .. Just bad service all together my husband & kids noticed we receive all our food at once appetizers,soup & meal and desert .. When I request to speak to manager he never came out to speak with us . This happened on a night when only 30% of tables had people (it was not busy) I will never go back.. Very disappointed in our waitress but even more that management would not even talk to us .. I paid for my meal I just wanted him to know how our waitress was acting but I guess I now understand why she didn't care .. Her boss didn't either ;(
Great place for late night dinner. French onions soups is delicious and their burgers are always the best. Love the service and ambiance. Prices are very reasonable.
Always friendly service when I go, the food is always incredible. The endless fries and seasoning salt is amazing. Will definitely be returning.

So my boyfriend & I are regulars at red robin we love coming and our main locations that we go to are the one in Costa mesa across from south coast and the one at the district ! , so I decided we might as well try this one out. My first impression was this place is nice and big the hostess is friendly and its not too busy so that means minimal wait time. So when me and my boyfriend sit down no one notices us were just sitting there talking the waitresses keep walking past us, it took them 10 minutes just to notice us and that's not an excuse because at every single BUSY restaraunt I've been to they've been able to take care of me with no problems , but this waitress seemed to not care too much about her job, she took so long to notice us, and when I asked for a basket of fries there was literally like 5 fries in there so , bottom line worst red Robin experience of my life were defiantly not coming back there again. The only reason I gave 2 stars was because the food was good.

I really used to like this spot--close to my friend's house when I visit her. Now, lackluster, inattentive host, lots of tables left unbussed (informed that there is only one busboy--saw him on his phone on patio while dishes piled up).  Wayyyy to many dirty tables--very unappetizing to be seated by dirty areas. Borderline health code issues.  Waitresses generally fine (Megan good), but may be new management? Just reslly sloppy.  Strangely, bathrooms cleaner than eating areas. Step it up RR!!! Hire new/more busboys & host/esses.

I don't come here often, mainly because I'm attempting to stay healthy. However I must say that when I do come to red robin, it's always good. I have no complaints. I know they offer healthier options, but what's the point of coming to a burger restaurant and not getting a burger. The waitresses are always friendly. I'll come here again.

Came here for my first time last night (Friday the 12th). Right off the bat this location grabbed my interest due to its larger size and unique layout. I usually go to the Brea location, so this was something a little different (despite being the same restaurant)... My party was greeted upon arrival and waited roughly 10 minutes for a seat. I saw quite a few open seats, but didn't feel the need to question the hostess's seating techniques. Once we got our seats, it was only a few minutes before our waitress, Alyssa, came by. She was/is extremely attractive (just had to put that out there), but unfortunately very inattentive to our table. Took a while to get our water cups, order food, get refills, etc - the whole meal basically lagged. Then to top it off, we asked for our separate bills so we could pay and leave, and that also took forever. Once we got them, we slipped our cards with our respective bills hoping she would take them back quickly, but of course that didn't happen. I did notice Alyssa was constantly bouncing around in the bar area, so her attention seemed more focused around there. This location should reconsider bar employees also being table waiters away from the bar, as that doesn't seem to be working. While I would normally suspect slower service on a busy and/or understaffed day (which is the common excuse), it was nothing like that. There were plenty of employees working that night, and it was not busy (compared to say, a saturday evening).. The food was ok. I got my personal favorite, the royal red robin burger. While it wasn't terrible, it definitely wasn't up to standard. There was a ridiculous amount of mayonnaise on it. Others in my party complained that their food was undercooked, and the fries tasted as though they had been sitting for quite some time (not even warm by the time they got to us). With all this considered, I cant say I was too impressed with this location or the food. They have some ghetto looking females working at this spot (not including Alyssa), and while the location itself is pretty nice - the food and poor service kills it for me. Maybe we came on a bad night, but seeing other recent reviews tells me I am not the only one.. Perhaps with a little motivation, the managers/employees can get a better routine down.

Nothing compares to a delicious burger!!! Well - it's an added bonus when you have exceptional customer service. I cringe every time I take my (very) energetic six year old to dinner. He is a boy who is wired for talkative antics that would rival the Energizer Bunny for days. And tonight was no different. Yes, I am that Mom with a child whose actions embarrass me so much that I blush with a very apologetic smile to the other patrons, as if to say "I only wanted Red's delicious Bacon Cheeseburger - please bear with me." But tonight was different and that is all thanks to our waiter Wilson. We were greeted at our table shortly after we were seated and Wilson's gracious demeanor was somewhat of a relief for me, telling me without even saying that it was going to be okay, and that the meal I was set to have would make things better. Which they did; Wilson took the children's order and swiftly returned with their drinks. The rest of our food was brought out in a timely manner as well as every time we asked for something; Wilson gladly brought back what we needed - even if it was the 4th cup of ranch dressing to accompany Red's delicious and bottomless steak fries. All that to say this: thank you to the evening shift's Rockstar - otherwise known as Wilson. Your patience with our very loud table is much appreciated. Great and exceptional employees within the Food & Service Industry are what make great dining experiences and are the building blocks to earning patron loyalty. Granted, I am now leaving - still with my wild child (sigh.....j/k) but on a full belly from a wonderful meal as well as a smile on my face!

This review is about the "new" Avo-Cobbo" salad I had last night.  It was HORRIBLE! Corporate has changed what was the BEST cobb salad around into the WORST cobb salad around.  No more romaine lettuce - now a handful of iceberg with a small dab of spring mix.  Doesn't work on a cobb salad.  They got rid of the eggs and olives.  They are now putting cucumber instead of the egg.  The portion size is less than half of the original salad size.  The ONLY thing that hasn't changed is the chicken.  It is still the same portion and still good.  At BEST maybe a tablespoon of each of the condiments are put on now.  No longer the chibata bread, but two small slices of cheaper buttered / garlic bread.  My guess is that they are trying to make more money.  This is the wrong way of going about it.  Increase the menu price if you have to, but I felt SO ripped off having to pay for that bad tasting garbage last night.  They have lost a VERY loyal customer (I'm in there one to two times a week just for the Avo-Cobbo salad).  I'm angry that I have to go try other restaurants to find another cobb salad that is equal to what Red Robin used to have.  Lazy Dog's cobb salad was pretty good but I don't want to drive that far for dinner from where I am.   The staff at the Orange restaurant are great -- especially Ryan and Emily.  I will miss them.
New Cesar salad ...2 leaves crisscrossed with a sprinkle of cheese $5.99 - really!!!! Love Red Robin but will never order that again

The food is good - a solid 3 - but the new salt shakers usually feel like they have some kind of grease on them. Unfortunately, they're now the TWIST kind, so you have to grab them with both hands and get BOTH hands greasy to get salt or pepper on the food. I actually had to wipe down the one we used today before it was fit to use.  Hence the 2 star rating. Also, no toothpicks.  I'm getting kind of tired of this. Why is Red Robin too cheap to get little tiny wooden toothpicks for its guests?

Burgers are good but service wasnt that great. We were sitting on the patio and the waitress wouldnt come out to take orders after the first round. We would have ordered much more but she never came back..we had about 20 people in our party and we had to keep going to the bar and chasing down the waitress to take orders. We also had to chase her down for the check at the end. Then the checks were incorrect. Just bad service..food was good.

As soon as we sat down the server justin came and took our order so service was great he got our drinks and checked on us constantly and placed our order right away. The only bad thing was we have been waiting for our food for about 30 mins my friend ordered the Tavern double and I ordered the spicy jalapeño salad.  So in conclusion it's was ok and the food was great just a little slow in the delivery.
Red Robin is my go to place for salads! The servers are super friendly. The portion sizes are perfect! Love the simply grilled salad and the Avo-Cobb-O salad.

Considering we come here probably at least once a week, I think this place is great. We usually dont need to wait, the pricing is just about right. The servers are always nice. And the bottomless fries doesnt hurt.

This location just received my last visit for quite some time. Last several visits service has been poor even non existent at times. Cleanliness is not as it should be. The best service we received was from the hostess.

Went here for lunch during my lunch break. Got the Tavern Double with Bottomless Fries. The burger was delicious and very cheesy. The fries were hot, but not gold and crispy enough for my taste. The waiter was very nice, but needed to pay attention a bit better especially since the lunch hour here was not very busy. All in all, the food and experience was pretty good. :)

The service at this location sucks. I love RR's food but will not be visiting this location for it. I would rather drive miles away to another location with better service. Even the to go sucks. I called to place an order and was put on hold for 7 minutes.

I ate here for lunch last Sunday and had excellent service! I tried an amazing new spicy burger on the menu and loved the garlic fries! My friend got a shake and enjoyed every drop! As a former employee of the hospitality industry, I am always appreciative of excellent service. My server Justin was perfectly attentive, kept our drinks refilled, and made sure we were well taken care of. I noticed he had several other tables and a large party but never missed a beat. I hadn't been to Red Robin in years and can't wait to go back! Thank you Justin M!

Disappointing!  We have been coming to this location for years and are usually pleased with the service.  We went tonight and the service was very inattentive.  The food tasted good but none of our entrees were hot upon arrival to our table.   It seemed like our meal was sitting unclaimed for a while which also explains the long wait for our food.

This Red Robin was awesome ! Excellent service from the waitress and thr food was delicious. I would highly recommend this restaurant to others . The prices are good , most important no wait for food or drinks.

When I came to this place, about a month back, they were still going through construction. I don't know how long its been going on but typically its not too attractive while this is going on. Unfortunately I have to agree with some of the other reviews on this specific Red Robin as the service was just horrible. In my section they had 2 servers tag teaming a section of tables. Tell me how no one came to get our orders for 10 minutes. Once someone finally got our orders they took about another 10 minutes to get our order of fries. They dropped off me and my wifes drinks but totally forgot about my sons chocolate milk, now I'm getting upset. I ordered a salad and they dropped it off without getting my silverware and I sat there, NOT EATING, for another 10 minutes until someone finally realized I didn't have a fork. Same with the others, the check did not get paid for some time as they seemed to forget I was there again. Never coming back to this spot and am disappointed in Red Robin as a whole.

I always enjoy Red Robin. Delicious burgers. Good environment. Great service.  Place is always welcoming.  We eat here every couple months and we always leave with full bellies and happy.  Due to the food showing up quickly I have to cut this review short. But it sure looks good

I took my mom here one day since she was craving a burger and I am vegan (vegetarian while pregnant so double check with the server about whether the burger is made with eggs).  I loved my burnin love veggie burger - no cheese.  It was not too spicy at all, but I like spicy. My mom had the bleu ribbon and said it was the best burger she's had in a long time.  We also had endless fries because when you're eating for two ... Why not?!?!   Red Robin - YUM!

Well, if you like to wait forever to order your food then this is the place to be. The servers seemed to prefer hanging out in the patio where no customers were seated instead of serving the actual customers. Also, if you like to bring your own utensils and napkins to restaurants then you'll love it here because providing that sort of stuff is not high on their priority list. Food was average. Wish the service was as good.

Where should i start.I came here with my son and husband during the evening and it was under construction which is ok with me as long as we et good service.Well we didn't. We got sat down after we waited about 20 minutes and no one took our order for about 15 min.Then a server came and we ordered our drinks then waited another 10 to 15 min to get our drinks and they forgot to bring my sons drink..not ok with me.having a toddler asking for his drink non stop sucks.well finally we ordered  (by that long wait we were starving )we ordered and by the time the food got there the server just dropped it of didn't ask if we needed anything.we had no forks or spoons .how in the hell am i suppose to eat my salad and feed my son his mac n cheese.we waited for another 10 minutes before someone realized we existed. Red robin is not what it used to be which is disappointing. I would suggest not going to this red robin,service sucked and thats very important to me. Fyi we didnt not tip one cent

I love the DGB Burger, but I only ever eat half of it!  This post it to say the best ever leftover hamburger comes from Red Robins!!!  I eat it cold, just as is.  It's the best leftover cold burger ever!!!  Come on, a cold leftover burger?!  Try it!!  And FYI, don't ever order the DGB Burger from the Brea Mall location!  Mine came drowned in the oil sauce, floating on my plate, couldn't even take a bite!!! Sorry, Brea!  Orange Mall all the way for so many years!

I've been going to this Red Robin for as long as I can remember. Our last visit was after the recent rennovation, and it was so dissapointing! The new design felt less home-y and more corporate. It was also waaay too bright. Probably had twice as many lights as they needed. The patio off the bar was gone, due to the new mall construction I'm assuming, and the ambiance was just not what it used to be. I felt like I lost a part of my childhood! The service was average-it was packed so it took longer than normal for a server to take drink orders, bring utensils, etc. Food was good though! Unfortunately I'm sad to say I won't be pushing to eat Red Robin when deciding where to go for dinner anymore
The Bonsai Burger was 2 1/2 stars. (Small Patty) and the  whiskey river Burger was great 4 stars. Excellent customer service both from our waiter Patrick and Gus our manager.

Love the food and that's why I always come here but service sucks every damn time and this particular time was the absolute worst. I always come to this location with low expectations in the service department as the food makes up for it but we will no longer come here and just drive a little further to Brea and deal with their usual 20 min + wait time. The hostess was sick and sounded nasty. She initially took us to the bar even though we asked to be seated in the dining area, then the table she took us to had crumbs all over the table and chairs and she just watched us as we swept it  off with our hands. We had to wave down our waitress to place our drink order as she was in the corner talking with another waitress for several minutes. Our drinks and food came out quickly and was delicious but again we had to wave down the waitress for more fries and refills. Keep in mind, the restaurant is barely 1/3 full at the most. Sadly we had to remind the waitress twice for refills as she kept hanging out in the corner with another waitress and the hostess!!! It's a shame the service declined this much when it was already pretty bad on a regular basis.
Service was good we were sat down right away.  Friendly helpful staff, food was fresh and came out quickly.  It might have been because it's Monday night but all was good.

Kent was such a pleasant waiter..although I think he was new and seemed timid at first I had ordered sweet potato fries and they were cold he immediately fixed the problem and took them off the bill...over all it was a pleasant experience

I love their garden burgers and their fries are really taste good! I also enjoy their teas! There are so many types to choose from! I am also impressed with the serving staff. Always right on target. I am not giving them five because of one bad experience. There was a waiter that decided to take a tray full of drinks and spilled it all over right by us. He then handed one drink as it was dripping with the other people's drink. He did not even clean it up himself, but someone else had to clean up his mess. So many drinks had spilled, it made my booth sticky. I was not impressed with this waiter. I have not seen him since, so hopefully he was fired. It was not that he spilled the drinks, it was the lack of responsibility he took. I even had to point out the glass and alcohol under our booth.
Always a good choice if a burger is what you crave. Royal Red Robin is a mainstay. The kids enjoy it too.
Crazy Impressed! Service was excellent, burger was better than that, AND my kids cleaned thier plates!!!!!

Wish I could give 0 Stars!! The food was so disgusting! Salad tasted like dirt, burgers were dry, prime rib sandwich was shoe leather and their signature fries were old, over cooked and greasy! Usually the best thing is the bottomless fries, but now they are disgusting! I stopped going here two years ago because their sewer problem smelled so bad you couldn't eat in the restaurant! But with the remodel we tried it again. But never again! Glad they brought back the artichoke/spinach dip but it is so small now its not worth ordering! With the orange mall getting everything new, too bad there isn't a different restaurant replacing red robin. So disappointing!

Order black and bleu burger NO onions. Thank god I didn't have an allergy there were hidden onions everywhere. The kitchen manager came out and apologized. He was accommodating, but now I have to go somewhere else to eat. Sorry to say not coming back here again.

Waiting for our food still so I can't say much about that but.... the waitress actually made me feel stupid and laughed at me for asking about the menu. Worst thing is I have to tip because we're in a large group. She then said if my order is wrong it's my fault because I asked for a different bun and type of cheese. I'm very unhappy so far. 30 min into this visit and a server came by with the wrong food, still waiting for my food. The food was much better then the initial service.

Food was good but server didn't know how to give decent service.  First arriving with my friends there was no hostess to help us. We waited for her to get to the stand to seat us. After seating us our server ruin FOREVER to greet us but I wouldn't be able to tell you her name since she never told us. After a while of waiting she finally came to take our drink order. The rest of the night was pretty much the same . Waiting forever for her to come help us, bring us our food, or ask if we need refills . I would come back if I had another server

I hadn't been to this location since the remodel, but I remember it being really good food and service. This time, unfortunately, not so much. Both my fiancé and I got the wrong order and by the time we got our actual order, it was cold. It seems they focused all their attention on the remodel and let the food get neglected.

I've always been a fan of Red Robin.... Been to numerous different locations more times than I can count, but was disappointed with the things we ordered here tonight. Service was good, which it should have been since we were one of about 5 people eating in the whole place tonight (never seen it so dead in here), and got a nacho appetizer with no cheese on it; chips covered in sour cream and chili, but had no cheese for some reason, and if I'm understanding the concept of nachos here, THEY SHOULD HAVE CHEESE. The chili was kinda gross too. We then I ordered fries with American cheese, thousand island dressing and bacon bits, and even that was bad. They put down the fries, then the Thousand Island, then melted the cheese on top of that making it all a soggy mess. They call it dressing because it goes on last...it goes fries, cheese, then dressing.  I'm sorry to say the food here at this visit sucked. I will go back to Red Robin based on many past meals here that were pretty good...I don't expect 5 star fare here, but Red Robin has always been good for what it is....decent food and decent prices, and they have a bar which puts them ahead of Denny's or Carrows, but this was a disappointing visit.
Came in for dinner tonight with some friends. Food is delicious and quick for a Friday night. Our server Chatelle took really good care of us!!

The food and drinks were as delicious as I'd expect of a Red Robin, but even on a not-so-busy Tuesday night, the service was disappointingly slow. (My party of three waited almost 45 minutes for our food after ordering; and the restaurant was only about half-full.)

Service was way too slow on a Saturday night. Food was either too sweet or too salty. The ordering system on the tablet wasn't efficient. There were games on the tablet but they charge $2. Not a good experience.

I really enjoy coming to this red robin. It is actually the only one I come to. Every time I've been here its always been an enjoyable visit. My boyfriends and I always go to the bar area since we like to watch basketball and have a few beers. The bartenders are always so friendly and caring. They make our visit very comfortable and fun. The food is also always delicious. Keep up your great customer service bartenders!!

I came in the other night with my girlfriend. Our server was Meagan. She was amazing, the BEST waitress I have ever had. Thank you for the fast service Meagan! And thank you Red Robin for the AMAZING food.

We have been waiting for 30 minutes to get our food, seems like this place has lost its customer service,  we are not happy with the service or the attitude of the staff. The only saving grace was the manager Jim, he made the effort to make sure we were taken care of

I'm not a real fan.  The Tavern Double has a taste to it that I don't care for.  The more expensive burgers are pretty good but I can get a better burger for $14.49 then here.  The staff is very attentive and the service is good.

Came here to have some drinks with my wife. We were seated in the bar section and waited 15 minutes with no service. We watched 2 females at the bar attempt to flag down the bartender for a drink, the male bartender was to busy throwing a fit about something to pay attention to them. He then threw a menu and said "are you fucking serious" loud enough that I can hear from approx. 15 feet. My wife then ask the hostess up front if we could move seats. We then moved across the restaurant and had great service from a red head female (unknown name). I ordered a beer from the new seat and it didn't come before my food so I just cancelled the order. Never had this kind of service in any restaurant bar. We will never come back to this location.

Yelp challenge 2016  104/116 I am a burger girl, living in a burger world. One way to please me is with a juicy burger. I don't need anything fancy to egnite my taste buds just a good burger. Red Robin at The Village of Orange is A okay. Such high competition in the burger world. They have been upping their game over the past year offering bigger and better burgers. They may not be the best burgers in town, but I dig them. Kind of hard not to like them with bottomless fries. This location is special. I'll tell you why. I ate here before I walked into the mall and found the love of my life staring at me behind her glass cage.  I'm a fan. 3 stars cuz there are better burgers I gave 4 stars to and I rarely give 5. #903

I'll give two stars because my kid did liked his food. But service was way too slow, food was ok but food takes long to get to the table, and just hope you have all you need to start eating or you will sit there waiting again for waiter to check back at the table. And keep the fries coming!!! I get better service at Carl's.

I love Red Robin!!! This is my go to place for delicious fries and a a spicy burger. My favorite burger is the Burnin' Love! Delicious!!! With bottomless fries?!? Yes please. If you like to add a kick to your fries then dip your fries in buzzard sauce and ranch. So good.  If you're looking for something lighter, the croissant turkey sandwich is my next favorite. I'm very picky about croissants and this is soft and fluffy.  I love the redo inside the restaurant! It feels less chaotic.  Definitely a great place to go!  PS...sign up for the red royalty rewards and get a free burger the month of your birthday, plus after 10 burgers you get one free! This comes in handy if you have a big family like I do. They also offer discounts and free appetizers at random for rewards members.
Good food as usual but still a bit too pricy for a family of five. Service was great for having such a big party (10) at a late hour.

I ordered a double hamburger thinking it would be a Red Robin regular burger with double the meat but was given a hamburger that had two four ounce patties and was very disappointed. I didn't know that they have two different patties sizes.  For close to $10.00 I would have never guessed that I was ordering the small size patties. It was very disappointing for me. Everyone else in my party was happy since they didn't  order what I did.  Make sure you are not ordering the smaller patties if you go.

First of all , my waiter was very new. Gave the wrong order so he had to take it back another 10 minutes before I got me food. the knife  I got had food from previous customers very very sick.... Beer was hot I felt like I was drinking coffee NEVER AGAIN DO I COME BACK HERE...

Nope. When I've gone here I've always waited a long period of time for my food, but tonight I was never even seated! I was told I would be seated in 15 minutes, and waited 50 without any luck so I left. I'd maybe understand if it was friday or saturday night but no it's Sunday and other parties were being sat before mine. Lame.

Today is Wednesday June 29th year of 2016 we were at the Red Robin restaurant we came to have a bite to eat at 9:15 p.m. we walked into the bar area for dinner and there were all kinds of extra items from the bar covering the entire bar area  plastic objects and steel wire racks for silverware or something. Not sure what it was but something from the bar area we approached the bar with bewilderment and look at the bartender in the eyes however he would not look at us he looked away made us feel as though we were unwelcomed..We asked if we could please sit down to have a meal and he said we are closing. We looked at our watch but its 9:20 . He  rude and didn't accommodate at all as a matter fact made us feel quite awkward. Mostly interested in what appeared to be his friends at the bar that he needed to entertain. I do not recommend going to Red Robin anytime after 9 p.m. or else they'll kick you out and make you feel awkward .

Way to go, Nicole and the gang! Really busy but great service and awesome food!! We were pleasantly surprised with all of it!!! Loved the Whiskey burger and mint brownie shake! Thanks for a great Friday night dinner!

How embarrassing is it for me to get up and ask for napkins. My waiter was helping other people when it takes 2min to get napkins. I also asked her for more fries and she continued to take other people's orders, really? This place has really gone down on quality! Both Food and service. Smh -Kay Von Kakes
I have been to a few Red Robins, this is one of the best. Great service and food. Worth the drive/walk from Disney.

I am very very disappointed in not only the quality of the food but the customer service.I went before rush hour so there were barely any people inside.  They started us with a basket of cold fries and I ordered the cod burger which had no flavor, plus all of the drinks tasted like they came right from the toilet.  As we were leaving all the workers were occupied blabbing to each other about there social lives rather than being concerned about my service.  I would give it a zero if I had the option which is a shame because I generally love red robin.

We walked in and were told there would be a 20 minute wait!   You definitely need to get a new gal at the check in!  One who stands tall and doesn't slouch over the cabinet that is holding her up.  Also, stop playing with your hair! Massive amounts of empty tables.  After 20 minutes we did get seated!    Julio comes up, takes our order, our meal didn't appear for over 30 minutes.  He only checked on us once while we were eating, finally when he did check on us, we were finished and both with empty glasses, yes I drink a lot of water and yes I like my drink refilled during my meal not after. We sat next to the wall in the middle of the room and he reached over to give us our receipt,  if you are that lazy that you can't walk around and hand us the receipt with was only a couple more steps, you need another job.  The avo-Cobb was delicious and my Dad's mushroom burger was cooked to perfection.  As for the garlic fries, per my Dad, there wasn't much garlic on them.

Bad bad bad bad bad service worst red robin ever. No manners of how to take care of  guest. Waited 20 min to get seated. Finally got seated girl who was taking our Order was too slow. She took our order our order came after 30 min my order was totally wrong asked for no bacon burger  my burger had pieces of bacon. Some other Server Came to serve our food   dropped the chili sauce on table instead of cleaning it properly just wiped with small piece of napkin.  When we asked for our server she came, i told her I want to reorder the food since it was totally wrong. She took order and told us she will give some fries till our food is out waited waited waited for 30 more min for fries and food nothing came. We were starving since we both came right after work. Had to leave the place without eating anything. WORST PLACE TO GO. Don't waste your money. They need better and more trained staff

*****VERY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE***** As my family and I walked in and stood in front of the hostesses for a few seconds, one hostess briefly looked at me and abruptly said, "GIVE US 5MINS" as if we were bothering them by interrupting their conversation.  There was NO warm welcome as we entered... NO...Hello, Welcome to Red Robin  NO...eye contact  NO...smile on the hostesses faces and NO...explanation as to why we needed to wait 5mins We were basically dissmissed as they continued with their conversation. As we sat down waiting to be seated, we  noticed that the restaurant was NOT busy. There were 4 people at the bar and 5 families eating in the restaurant. First impressions go a long way AND start with the hostesses.  Unfortunately, these two ladies have very poor customer service skills. Not sure if this issue is due to lack of management,  lack of training or if these ladies really do not care about "Customer Service" After being ignored for 2 1/2 mins, we walked out. Sorry Red Robin.... I'll take my business elsewhere!  I gave this restaurant...1 star ONLY because there was NO option for a NEGATIVE star!!

Worse experience ever! Manager tried to fix the problem but waitress was awful. After placing my concern to the manager waitress came over and asked what was said. There was a bug in my son's drink and my burger was cold. Lastly while waiting for the waitress so that we could pay and get change for a tip. I over heard another customer requesting another diet coke and cup of coffee. She then suggested  that maybe they should be placed in to go cups. Customer then let her know that they wanted to drink it at the restaurant.

Just walked out half an hour ago after we stood in the entry waiting for someone to come seat us while we listened to the phone ring off the hook as well. When the hostess finally came, she mosied her way up and didn't apologize for the wait. Just said " hello. how many?". When seated the waitress was taking the drink order behind us and then said she would be with us in a minute. We watched the table of six across from us looking around, asking each other where the heck their drinks were. She finally came with their drinks, then walked away again to go get the other tables drinks. That's when we got up and left. Should have took a clue when we were standing in the entry.

Well, since my last restaurant burger wasn't that great, I figured I would come here and make up for it. I'll give you a clue where it was at. It's in Anaheim hills and you have a 50/50 chance on guessing it! Hahaa I came on a Tuesday night and it didn't take long before I got my seat.  I ordered the mushroom and Swiss burger (medium well) with sweet potato fries. I must say that this burger definitely...made up for the mess that I had at the other place! I also loved the fact that I had extra mushroom to eat that spilled over on the plate! The sweet potato fries were very good too!  I would have given it five stars, but the floors were very dirty and the tables were left un attended for a while after customers left.  My waiter, Julio was fantastic!!! Always checking on me. It still allowed me time to eat and enjoy my food! Her was very attentive and professional! Thank you!!!

WHAT HAPPENED to Red Robin?! I mean, seriously! I grew up going to Red Robin for every birthday, I craved their fries, the service and food was consistent...but WOW, I'm sad to say after this last dinner experience, I will never return. PS: everything at this location literally tastes like dirty dish water.

Came here for lunch today because it was close to work and we were on the mood for burgers.  We were greeted immediately upon entering the restaurant. The hostess was prompt in bringing us to our seats. The server came over with waters right after we sat down and came back five minutes later to take our drink orders.  And it arrived five minutes later. We told him we're weren't ready for food orders yet, by check back in a few minutes.   He came back five minutes later and took our orders.  We had their steak fries and onion rings were appetizers. The steak fries were fresh and had a good crunch. The onion rings had the perfect amount of bread/onion. And the dipping sauce was amazing. I ordered the Marco pollo, which is grilled chicken with peppered bacon and arugula. The chicken was cooked well; super juicy. And the bacon was a perfect crisp. I don't remember what everyone else ordered, but everyone enjoyed their burgers. Our drinks were refilled once they were about 1/3 full; which was awesome service. I haven't seen that anywhere else. For dessert, we got their tower of donuts. The diameter of the donuts was about 2.5-3 inches; so a good amount; not too big, not too small. The texture is very similar to a cronut if you've ever had one before. Fluffy and not too fried. All in all, it was a great fast meal. We were in an out in an hour.

How do you describe a chain restaurant? It's just one of those places you end up because one of your friends has a craving specifically for one of their burgers.  Does this sound familiar? Because that is why I ended up at Red Robin. Place was pretty packed for a nondescript Thursday night.  TGIT!  What do vegetarians or pescetarians eat at this joint? Probably the Garden Burger, which is what I got.  It's a veggie patty (Garden burger brand) with lettuce, tomato, pickle, and a mustard sauce.  It wasn't particularly memorable, hence why I did not take a photo of it.  I could have made this at home.  The fries are bottomless + delicious = a combination that makes America overweight (but yolo am I right?). They are unseasoned so you can DIY with the little seasoning shaker they have at the table.  I upended half the shaker onto my fries 'cuz that stuff is powdered gold.  Service was great! Our waitress was incredibly kind and attentive and patient when we all asked for 1,000 dipping sauces for our 1,000,000 fries.   Will I come back? Yes, when my friends force me to. I've been told they can replace any meat burger with the veggie patty.  Maybe I'll give that a go the next time around.  My whole thing with these types of chain restaurants is that they all run together in my memory like watercolors in a white rafting river.  Was this place Applebees? Was I actually at Fridays? Were we at Chili's when I ordered this? Had I not checked in I wouldn't be too sure.

It took forever for the hostess Kassandra to take my order after saying, "I'll get you your total right now." It took her pretty much my whole 30-minute lunch period to just place my order today that I had to go back to work and pick up my food after I was off, I don't think she quite understands the meaning of the word "now". Maybe don't say "now" and say "in several more minutes" instead? Also, my order was wrong and I didn't receive everything that I ordered. She didn't even apologize for the long wait either. Instead, her co-worker apologized to me as he could see how pissed off I was. You need to work on your customer service skills because they're sorely lacking and I won't ever bother ordering from this establishment again if my time is just going to be wasted like today.
Excellent service. Good burgers. I like the ability to pay or order from the table top device. I've never had a bad experience at this Red Robin.
I love the chicken tortilla soup & salad! Also they always have wonderful customer service!

Look, ya boi is a CluckHead, there's no denying that!  I love a good RR burger and you know what you're going to get when you come here, which isn't a bad thing.  This particular location had just okay service and the host sat our party next to a cold, rainy side door when there were plenty of other tables in the place. Food was great, service was okay!

The other night my boyfriend and I came for dinner we also brought our 7 week old son in his car seat.
